title: December Pixel Drop: New features for your Pixel phone, Tablet and more
description: Check out our Gemini updates, new Pixel Screenshots features and updates to make your devices work better together.
author: Mayra FajardoProduct Marketing Manager

html:
Dec 05, 2024

[[read-time]] min read

Introducing plenty of Gemini updates, Expressive Captions on Pixel, new Pixel Screenshots features and updates to make your devices work better together.

Bullet points

  • The December Pixel Drop brings new features to your Pixel phone, tablet, and more.
  • Gemini gets smarter with saved info, letting it remember your preferences for personalized responses.
  • You can now use Gemini to control smart home devices, play Spotify, and get information from Maps.
  • Call Screen gets smarter with Gemini Nano, suggesting contextual replies to unknown callers.
  • Pixel Screenshots automatically categorize your screenshots, making it easier to find what you need.

Summaries were generated by Google AI. Generative AI is experimental.

The latest Pixel Drop1 brings more intelligent, helpful and intuitive features to your devices, with new ways to use Gemini, camera improvements and security updates. Better yet, it brings some favorite features to more countries.

Use Gemini in new ways

Customize how Gemini helps you

Get more personalized responses from Gemini with the new saved info feature in Gemini Advanced. Saved info lets you ask Gemini to remember your interests and preferences so it can provide more helpful and relevant responses, tailored to your goals and needs.2 For example, tell Gemini you’re a vegetarian, and Gemini will remember and provide you vegetarian-friendly recipes without needing constant reminders. You can easily view, edit or delete any information you've shared as well as see when it’s used.

Get help across more of your favorite apps

We’re making it easier to access more apps and services from Gemini on Android. You can now ask Gemini to call personal contacts or businesses, as well as draft and send messages with your default phone and messaging apps. You can even set alarms, control your device settings, and open your camera to take a quick selfie.

We’ll be adding support for even more apps in the coming weeks. With the new Spotify extension3 you can play your favorite songs and discover playlists for any mood. You’ll be able to ask Gemini to control smart home devices that your Google Account can access such as lights, AC or TV, as well as ask Gemini for more information about a place on Maps and have it read reviews and scan websites to answer any questions.4

Additionally, Gemini Live5 is now available in more languages!

Answer phone calls the smart way

Screen calls with even smarter replies from Gemini Nano

Gemini Nano on Pixel can now suggest more contextual easy-to-tap replies for you in Call Screen.6 This means you can easily respond to unknown callers without having to take the call yourself. For example, if a package is being delivered, you can use this feature to respond to the delivery person by answering their yes or no questions or asking relevant follow-up questions — all via simple prompts that will show up on your screen.

See live transcripts of your screened conversations so you know if want to pick up

You can now peek into conversations between the caller and the AI agent during an automatic Call Screen. You can also answer or decline a call at any time during the screening session.7

Capture memories, get creative and stay organized

Share to social in fewer steps

Now you can capture and share Ultra HDR photos — full of bright intensity, higher contrast and more detail — right to your Instagram Feed.8

Easily find photos and videos to share on Snapchat

It’s even easier to find photos and videos that you want to share on Snapchat. Instead of scrolling through your device photo albums, now you’ll see all your folders, favorites and cloud photos through the Photo Picker.9

Strike a pose with Dual Screen

Don’t struggle to get the perfect portrait photo this holiday season: Take advantage of Dual Screen on your Pixel Fold and Pixel 9 Pro Fold in Portrait Mode so you and your photo subject can preview every shot before capturing the moment.

Get more smiles with Made You Look updates

Made You Look is now available on the first-generation Pixel Fold! Use fun animations on the outer screen to grab your little one's attention and snap a photo at the perfect moment.

Plus, Pixel 9 Pro Fold users get an extra treat: Joy from Disney and Pixar's Inside Out joins the fun, bringing even more smiles to your photos.10

Send Pixel Studio stickers right from Gboard

Want to show off your Pixel Studio sticker creations in more places? They’re now available in your Gboard keyboard, so you can share them with friends and family via messages, social media and more.11

Discover more wacky emoji mash-ups

Emoji Kitchen in Gboard is your source for all the weird and hilarious emoji mixes of your dreams. And now with updated navigation, it’s easy to find the perfect expression when a standard emoji isn’t enough, straight from your keyboard.12

Get super-organized with screenshots

New Pixel Screenshots13 upgrades will help you stay organized during a busy holiday season. For starters, when you're using Circle to Search14 and find something you like, you can save to Pixel Screenshots with just a tap so you can always find it later — no more lost gift ideas!

And Pixel Screenshots now automatically categorizes your screenshots, so it’s even easier to find exactly what you need with new search filters. When you find what you're looking for, Pixel Screenshots provides helpful suggested actions based on the information you saved — like creating a calendar invite or getting directions.

Pixel Screenshots also lets you add tickets or credit cards you’ve screenshot to Google Wallet15 giving you quick access to things like your driver’s license, boarding passes and more in one convenient spot.

And in Gboard, you’ll now see movie, music, product and other text suggestions from your screenshots while searching in relevant apps. Just turn on “Show suggestions from your screenshots in other apps” in the Pixel Screenshots app.

Listen (and look) at better audio-visual tools

Give your captions new life

Expressive Captions, now available for Android phones, uses AI to automatically capture the intensity and emotion of how someone is speaking for any content with sound on your phone, even livestreams.16 When you’re watching live sports, texting, using social media or watching a video message, you’ll see things like a gasp at a juicy secret, cheers and applause for a big win and all caps when someone is really excited.

Enjoy cleaner audio

Reduce noise and distractions automatically with the new update to the Recorder app. Whether you’re using the app to record a lecture or important interview, distracting background noises can make audio playback hard to follow. You can now enable the “Clear voice” feature on Recorder to focus on speakers and reduce background noise.17

Enjoy a smoother, faster Pixel experience

Make your Pixel easier to read and navigate

We’re introducing a new way to navigate your smartphone with Simple View. Simple View increases your phone’s font size and touch sensitivity, making it easier to see and use controls, apps and widgets.9

See what’s playing

Discover more songs and artists with Now Playing’s latest upgrade. You’ll now be able to see album art for each song in your Now Playing history, so it’s easier to explore new music.

Access controls on Pixel Tablet faster

You can now jump straight into using your go-to controls on your Pixel Tablet. All you have to do is swipe right from your tablet’s lock screen to access widgets for quick controls for your smart home devices, timers, music and more.18

Try expanded safety and security features

Travel with peace of mind

Are you traveling this holiday season? Now, when you’re in a new location, Identity Check in beta19 will require your face or fingerprint authentication before any changes to sensitive settings can be made on your phone. This gives you extra protection against anyone who might try to take your phone and access your passwords, change your PIN or turn off theft protection features.

Keep your data even safer

Previously only available on Pixel phones, you can now use our free built-in Google VPN on your Pixel Tablet.20 This means data like your internet traffic, private messages and photos, health information, banking details and location data are all protected when connected to public Wi-Fi networks.

Tune into your home from your wrist

See who's knocking at your door from your Pixel Watch 2.21 When you get a notification from your Nest Cam or Nest Doorbell, you can now see a live view of your porch and talk with whoever’s there right from your wrist.22

Check out health and safety tools in new regions

We’ve expanded access to Loss of Pulse23 Detection for Pixel Watch 3 users in Germany and Portugal. Loss of Pulse is a first-of-its-kind feature that can identify when someone’s heart suddenly stops beating due to conditions such as cardiac arrest, poisoning or respiratory arrest24, and then prompt the watch to call emergency services for help.25

For people in Germany, we’re also expanding access to Fall Detection26 for all Pixel Watch generations and Car Crash Detection27 to Pixel phones as well as Pixel Watch 2 and 3.

Stay in tune with your body’s recovery

Our enhanced Daily Readiness algorithm and new tools — Cardio Load and Target Load — originally launched with Pixel Watch 3. Now they're coming to Pixel Watches and Fitbit smartwatches and trackers that support Readiness28 starting December 9. Powered by Fitbit’s advanced health and fitness capabilities, these metrics help you know your body better and balance activity with recovery so you can optimize your workouts and rest to prevent overtraining. On Pixel Watches, you can view these metrics on-wrist within the Fitbit Today app or by adding the Readiness complication to your watchface, and for Fitbit devices you can view these metrics in your Fitbit mobile app’s Today tab.

The December Pixel Drop, as well as new Android features, begins rolling out today.
